Information expansion” Chinese code page character set
This document specifies Chinese graphic characters for information technology and their binary representations in hexadecimal.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other text graphic character information.

This document applies to technical products that have the function of processing and exchanging information of Chinese and other graphic characters, including but not limited to software products such as input method, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and Joern writing, and convenience products such as computers, communication terminal devices, electronic book readers, and learning machines.

4 words
4.1 Overview
The characters in this document are encoded in single-character, double-character, or four-character blocks.
The substring section includes all 128 characters from GB/T 11383-1989, 0x00~0x7F.
4.3 Two-letter elements
The bi-character part includes all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, the CJK Unified Han Character in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
Characters in the double-byte character set are defined in Appendix A.
Among them, the graphic, code position and function of the symbolic description should conform to the provisions of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is a unified code for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, South Korea, Vietnam, etc.
Chinese characters with unique abstract shapes are assigned a unique code position; Chinese characters with the same abstract shapes but different sources are assigned a shared code position.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-letter sections

The four-character segment includes 66 CJK Unified Han characters (9FA6 to 9FEF, excluding 9FB4 to 9FBB, 8 characters) in GB/T 13000, CJK Unified Han characters expansion A, CJK Unified Han characters expansion BCJK, CJK Unified Han characters expansion C, CJK Unified Han characters expansion DCJK, CJK
The characters in the four-character segment are defined in Appendix C.
5 Overall structure
In the text, the numbers preceded by 0x are in hexadecimal, and the numbers without 0x are in decimal.
All codes in the appendix are represented in hexadecimal, and other numbers are represented in decimal.
The segment of single characters uses the coding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, and uses the code position of 0x00 to 0x7F.
The double-byte character set uses two eight-bit binary strings to represent a character, the first byte is from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second byte is from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-bit segment uses 0x30 to 0x39, which are not used in GB/T 11383-1989, as the extension of the two-bit segment code, and the code range is 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first character of the four-character segment is the hexadecimal code range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character is the ASCII code range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third character segment is the hexadecimal code range of 0x81 to 0xFE; and the fourth character segment is the ASCII code range of 0x30 to 0x39. Description: The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both need to process the input file with one or more of the following four steps: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking.
The suffix of the source file indicates the language of the source file, but the suffix controls the default setting for the compiler:
gcc considers the preprocessed file (.i) as a C file and sets the connection in C format,
g++ considers the preprocessed file (.i) as a c++ file and sets up the connection in c++ style.
The source file suffix indicates the language type and the post-processing:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, and assembly.
C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, and assembly.
.cc C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, and compilation.
CXX C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, and compilation of assembly code
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, and assembly
.i preprocessed C file; compile, compile
.ii Preprocessed C++ files; compile, assemble.
.s is a compiled language source program; compiled.
Compile language source program; preprocessing, compilation
.h preprocessor file; usually does not appear on the command line. Other files with the same suffix are passed to the linker. They usually include:
.0 Object file
.a Archive file
Unless the -cec, -s, or -E options are used (or the compilation error prevents the complete process), the connection is always the last step.

During the linking stage, all the.e files, -1 library files, and unrecognizable file names (including specified.o H marker files and.a library files) corresponding to the source program are passed to the linker options in the order of the command line.
The options must be given separately: de ' is not the same as `-d -r '.
Most of the `-fname' and `-W' options have two opposite formats: `-fname' and `-fno-name' (or `-Wname' and `-Wno-name).
This is a list of formats that are not the default.

-fenum-int-equiv Allows implicit type conversion from ant type to enumeration type (MEF C++).

-fexternal-—templates is a template declaration that generates smaller code (only for C++) by creating a copy of each template function only where it is defined.
To successfully use this option, you must mark `#pragma implementation` (define) or `#pragma interface` (declare) in all files that use the template.
When you compile the program with `-fexternal-templates’, all the template instantiations are external types. You need to make the instantiations appear in the implementation files.
This can be achieved through typedef, which quotes each instance it needs.
Correspondingly, if the default option `-fno-extern-templates` is used at compile time, all template instances are explicitly set to be embedded.
All member functions (except constructors and the mnew or delete member operator) are considered virtual functions of their class.
This does not mean that every call to a member function will go through the internal vtable.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a function can be called directly; in this case, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch Allows type mismatches in the second and third arguments of the conditional expression.
The value of this kind of expression is Void.-fthis-—is-variable, which allows this to be assigned (for C++ only).
The merging of user-defined free storage management mechanisms into C++ makes the assignable `this’ outdated.
Therefore, by default, the implicit assignment of this inside a class member function is not valid.
However, for backward compatibility, you can make this work by using the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Various machines have their own default char type, which may be unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when the symbolic is data-dependent, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
But many programs are written to use only simple chars, and this is a symbolic number (or an unsigned number, depending on the target machine where the program is written).
This option, and its inverse, make such a program work on the corresponding default value.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it behaves exactly like one of them.
If no explicit `signed' or 'unsigned' modifiers are present, these options define a signed or unsigned bit field.
By default, the position is symbolic because the underlying integer types, such as int, are signed, but if the -traditional option is specified, the position is always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not do any special treatment.
This is to maintain compatibility with some old programs, and they think changing the string constant is a very bad idea, and the `-traditional’ option has the same effect.
Execution summary
Impact of COVID-19 on the drug market
Its impact could be similar to the economic crisis in 2008.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, the disease has overwhelmed healthcare systems and pushed them to the brink of collapse, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused severe disruptions to the global economy.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to make drugs as restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and essential chemicals.
Traffickers may have to find new routes and methods as they are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions.
Patterns of drug use and supply may change, and the government's ability to respond may be hampered.
The changes brought by the COVID-19 pandemic are unprecedented, but we can still learn from the lessons of past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began to look for cheaper synthetic substances and switched to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments have cut their drug-related budgets.

If governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, prevention measures and interventions, such as drug prevention and related risk behaviors, and detoxification and rehabilitation services, may be severely affected.
In addition, the priority of interception operations and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Countries with a high volume of drug smuggling through commercial flights are expected to be the most directly affected by the drug trafficking activities.

Messengers are carrying large quantities of synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine in their hand luggage or in their personal baggage. As restrictions on air travel have been imposed almost everywhere, the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs may be completely disrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain is also disrupted, the activities of using the dark web and parcel post to carry out trafficking may increase.
In the long run, the economic recession and the related lockdown measures could disrupt the drug market.

With rising unemployment and a lack of opportunities, the poor and vulnerable are more likely to use drugs in a harmful way, develop drug addiction and turn to illicit activities related to drugs, whether production or trafficking.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable people and recruit new members to grow their ranks.
As government capacity to respond diminishes, these shifts are likely to take root quickly, becoming the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
The population growth pattern partly explains the reason for the market expansion.
Drug addiction is increasing all over the world, both in terms of the overall number and the proportion of drug addicts in the world population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 21 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, and in 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
In the past two decades, the growth of drug use in developing countries has been much faster than in developed countries.

This reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also reflects the faster growth of young populations in developing countries.
Adolescents and young adults are the largest group of drug users.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group grew by 16% in developing countries, while it fell by 10% in developed countries.
1 Urbanization is a driving factor of the current and future drug markets.
In both developed and developing countries, the prevalence of drug abuse is higher in urban areas than in rural areas.

Part of the reason for the overall increase in drug use is the massive shift of people from rural to urban areas, with more than half of the world's population now living in urban areas, up from 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, particularly in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced.

The increase in wealth is associated with increased drug use, but the poorest people in the world bear the greatest burden of disease, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Drugs like cocaine are more firmly linked to the world's wealthier regions.
Similarly, within countries, the prevalence of drug use is higher among the wealthy.
However, the rate of conversion to drug addiction is higher among people with lower socioeconomic status.
Data from a few countries suggest that a harmful pattern of drug use is associated with disease and low income.
These patterns seem to be less common in wealthier social classes.
The economic constraints of the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable, including drug users.
For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have been linked to increased drug use, and the pandemic has already forced millions of people worldwide out of work.

COVID-19 could lead to further expansion of drug markets The COVID-19 pandemic could lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illicit crop cultivation, either because of reduced control by national authorities or because of the need to resort to illicit activities in times of economic crisis.

The related restrictions on COVID-19 have led to a decrease in air and land transportation, and maritime transportation may have increased as a result, with a low risk of interception at sea and a larger number of shipments than air or land smuggling.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine is being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
Complexity enhancement
The situation of non-international controlled substances is stable, but new types of opioids with potential harm are increasing, and the drug market is becoming more complex.

In addition to plant substances such as marijuana, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not under international control. The non-medical use of drugs is also rapidly increasing.
There are about 500 new active substances in the domestic market of member countries every year.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoids and a small amount of opioids.
Although the total amount of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
Among the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, the number of new psychoactive substances of the opioid type accounted for only 2%, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.

Many of the new psychoactive substances in the opioid family are similar to fentanyl, and their effects and dangers have been proven, leading to overdose deaths in North America, and to a lesser extent in other regions.
In North America, fentanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and is also used to make counterfeit prescription painkillers.

There is evidence that new psychoactive substances are also being injected in Europe: a study of waste from six European cities found that many of the syringes contained new psychoactive substances that produced a high.
2 The use of new psychoactive substances may be firmly entrenched in vulnerable groups
Single-substance novel psychoactive substances have rarely formed large markets.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prison inmates.
Twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most countries confirming synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

Controls on precursor chemicals have forced drug makers to innovate. Many chemicals used to make drugs such as methamphetamine, methcathinone and ecstasy have been placed under international controls.
Drug dealers and manufacturers have been looking for alternatives, not only substances with less regulation, but also chemicals designed to evade regulation, known as "tailor-made precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put further pressure on drug manufacturers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests this has become a reality: In March 2020, a shortage of methylphenidate precursors imported from East Asia reportedly led to a rise in methylphenidate prices in Mexico and the United States.
The market is constantly changing.
Synthetic drugs replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appeared to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The number of seized opioids in the Russian Federation decreased by about 80%, and the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use disorder decreased significantly.
But the market for stimulants seems to be growing.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including methylphenidate and a-pyrrolidinopentiophenone, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.

Russian authorities reported that the number of secret manufacturing sites for various illicit drugs seized recently has risen sharply, more than doubled in two years, increasing to 152 manufacturing sites in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq methamphetamine markets grow
As early as 2012, surveys of hospital, prison and other institutional staff had revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern, in addition to "fenethylline" and qumamid.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with drug users saying marijuana was harder to get than "Percocet" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the Iraqi authorities have discovered multiple methamphetamine processing sites, and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about the large import of pseudoephedrine, which is used as a precursor in the processing of methamphetamine.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine manufacture seems to have started in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing.
However, the seizure volume in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg, which was a significant increase compared with the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine believed to originate from Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, indicating that the country's production is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends of change
Most of the jurisdictions that legalized marijuana for non-medical use have seen an increase in marijuana use.
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the United States allow the production of marijuana products for non-medical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical cannabis use.

In Colorado and Washington, the two states that first legalized marijuana, adult use of the drug has increased, particularly in the past month and among those who use it daily or nearly daily, surpassing national averages since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, Uruguay's marijuana use has increased, and the use in the past month has almost doubled.
This suggests that the main reason for the increase is regular and frequent use of cannabis.
Short-term data in Canada also show that the use of cannabis has been increasing as the legal market expands from 2018 to 2019.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources.
Is the reason behind the global drop in the seizure of marijuana herb the legalization of marijuana?
In 2018, global cannabis herb seizures fell to their lowest level in two decades, as seizures in North America fell by 84% over the past decade.

In contrast, seizures in other parts of the world nearly doubled during the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at loosening the marijuana market have played a key role in the decline.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances seems to have a restraining effect, and the effect of regulation of new psychoactive substances in China is still difficult to evaluate.
Some countries with different regulatory systems for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence rates of new psychoactive substance use.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation.
Vulnerable populations face harm from both the legal and illegal drug markets, and opioids used for pain management and palliative care are not evenly distributed across regions.
In 2018, more than 90% of all opioids available for medical use were consumed in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% are in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
The population of these countries accounts for about 12% of the global population.
It is estimated that the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but consumes less than 10% of the pharmaceutical opioids.
Obstacles to obtaining opioids include legislation, culture, health systems, and prescribing practices.
People who are poorer are more likely to develop addiction. In 2018, about 35.6 million people suffered from addiction.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of and exacerbate the consequences of drug use. This has been confirmed by research in high-income countries, where individual socioeconomic trajectories have been found to be associated with the risk of drug use, not just at a particular point in time.

Drug use also deepens social and economic disadvantage, increasing the risk of unemployment, poverty and homelessness, thereby perpetuating a cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be related to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, minorities and immigrants, sexual and gender diverse groups, people displaced by armed conflict or disaster, and people living in rural environments may also be disproportionately affected by drug use disorders or face barriers to accessing treatment services.
According to disability-adjusted life years (DALYs), a measure of healthy life lost to disability and premature death, harmful drug use has had a wider social impact over the past decade.
From 2007 to 2018, the global disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) attributable to drug use increased by 17%.
The increase in life expectancy years with disability adjusted for the common untreated hepatocellular carcinoma in injecting drug users with hepatitis C is particularly high - up to 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
Limited data from around the world suggests that intoxication may be a significant factor in homicides.
But in violent incidents, alcohol's role seems to be greater than drugs.

While drug use may lead to crime, in some cases, this link can be partially attributed to a variety of intermediate factors, such as socioeconomic disadvantage, and other types of adversity, such as individual risk factors, family environment, and peer influences.
The connection between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, large-scale organized criminal activities, including international drug trafficking, may be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the existence and level of violence is more dependent on changes that destabilize the balance of power between trafficking groups, such as changes in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of well-known criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group and strengthen another.
Latest trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids are the most dangerous
It is estimated that 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug in the world.
By comparison, there were 58 million opioid users in 2018.
But the related hazards of opioids have been ignored due to the small number of users.

Of the estimated 167,000 drug-related deaths in 2017, 66% were caused by these substances, and 50% of the estimated 21 million years of life lost due to disability or premature death attributable to drug use were caused by these substances.
Non-medical use of synthetic opioids exacerbates public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, ketamine is exacerbating the opioid crisis; in North America, it is fentanyl. The two regions have almost nothing in common in terms of economic, demographic or general drug use patterns, but they are both struggling with opioid crises fueled by readily available and cheaply produced substances.
In North America, the use of synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has led to a 20-year increase in opioid overdose deaths.
In 2018, two-thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths in the United States involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason that fentanyl causes overdose deaths is that fentanyl is unpredictable in the illicit drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the market for non-medical use of khat has grown significantly.
In the region, more and more patients with the disease are receiving treatment with Qumado.
In 2017, the global seizure of rhino horns increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
However, in 2018, after India passed a new law to regulate the production of ketamine, the global seizure volume fell to 32 tons.
The crisis in both places was fueled by the manufacture of simple and inexpensive products, and the lack of international regulation of ketamine and many other opioids and their precursors.
The crisis in both places is worsened by the fact that these substances are available on both the pharmaceutical and the black markets, making it harder to detect and prevent their abuse.
Use of stimulants continues to rise
The cocaine and methamphetamine markets are the largest for stimulants, and use of both is increasing in their primary markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as cocaine is popular in North America and Western Europe.
There are an estimated 27 million people who use amphetamines, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine-type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has been expanding for 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist and sometimes substitute each other, so that the use of one drug increases while the use of the other decreases, or both increase and decrease to meet the demand of the same market.
COVID-19 increases the risk of injecting drug use
It is estimated that there were about 11.3 million people who injected drugs in 2018, and about 10% of the global HIV infections were caused by injecting drugs.
More than 1 million people who inject drugs are infected with HIV, and 5.5 million people have hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died of drug overdose, half of whom died of liver disease caused by hepatitis C, and most of the injecting drug users with hepatitis C have not been treated.
The shortage of opioids caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to substitute with more readily available substances such as alcohol or benzodiazepines, or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs.
As some users switch to injection or more frequent injections, more harmful use patterns may emerge.

EU summit is in a dilemma over the refugee policy, EU officials: the process of receiving refugees is stuck at every step - ECNS
EU summit is in a difficult position on the refugee policy, and EU officials: every step of the reception process has bottlenecks

According to a report by Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on that day, the President of the European Commission, von der Leyen, said that the leaders of the EU agreed to introduce stricter policies on illegal immigrants, making it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

The move by the EU is reportedly in response to growing concerns over illegal immigration in Europe, where the core problem is that the number of illegal immigrants who can ultimately be repatriated is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been arguing over the cost of the fence.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some diplomats from member states said that if the EU could share the cost of installing cameras, watchtowers and other infrastructure along its external borders, it would free up national budgets and speed up construction.

According to the European Euractiv website, EU officials admitted that every step of the refugee reception process was a bottleneck, and the limited reception capacity and overburdened immigration authorities of member countries could not stop refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in EU countries, and the refugee reception system of the EU was in a near-"permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, the Schengen countries in the EU received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, nearly half more than the previous year.
Meanwhile, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.

In this context, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle" that EU countries can send back illegal immigrants to their home countries according to the judgment of the court of another member country.
In addition, the report said that the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which will pave the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifeng)
The United States has upgraded the “chip war” to severely damage the global semiconductor industry - www.chinanews.com

Recently, the US-China “chip war” has been escalating——First, the Netherlands and Japan, under pressure from the US, agreed to launch controls on the export of Chinese semiconductor manufacturing equipment; later, foreign media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, banning US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to release an executive

In recent years, the United States has never stopped its actions to suppress China's development of chips, on the one hand, it has accurately suppressed the supply chain of semiconductors to China, and on the other hand, it has constructed a semiconductor industrial chain alliance of "de-China", aiming to completely "break away" from China in the field of advanced semiconductors.

Whether it is to establish a “technology alliance” with South Korea or a “semiconductor alliance” with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a “semiconductor industrial chain circle” through the “Quadrilateral Mechanism” and the “Indo-Pacific Economic Framework” of the United States, Japan and Australia, the United States aims to build a closed industrial chain dominated by the United States by introducing the
However, the United States’ “chip strategy” against China is a “hurt the enemy a thousand times and hurt oneself eight hundred times”.

Recently, the famous chip manufacturing equipment supplier in the United States, the Broadcom Group, announced that the company would lay off 1,300 full-time employees due to the latest round of export bans on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment, and planned to lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters.

The Dutch ASML Holding, a global leader in lithography machines, recently warned that banning the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to a rise in the price of semiconductors.

According to analysis by American media, after the US government imposed brutal pressure on the semiconductor and other industries in China, many American companies suffered, including developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of wafer fabrication equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States claims to suppress China’s advanced semiconductor industry, but it drags down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and the global semiconductor industry chain has formed a close link.

According to the estimation of professionals, based on the professional division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the border of various countries more than 70 times, and the whole process takes 100 days.

Although the semiconductor industry in the United States is relatively strong, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technologies, and is heavily dependent on the East Asian region.

Even if the United States tries to guide the advanced chip supply chain to the regionally developed “small circle” dominated by the United States, the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry will be difficult to change.
The United States has made a strong attempt to “rebuild” the semiconductor industry chain and has severely damaged the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industry in the world, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the joint participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, including the American Innovation and Competition Act, the American Competition Act 2022, and the Chips and Science Act, to use technological hegemony to consolidate the technological advantages of the United States; it has used “carrots and sticks” to coerce semiconductor manufacturers such as Intel, Taiwan Semiconductor
In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China's semiconductor industry and related industries and gained real benefits.

However, in the long run, the United States’ excessive suppression will force China’s semiconductor industry to break through, and the United States will lose a huge Chinese market, which will ultimately greatly weaken the innovation intentions and innovation capabilities of American technology companies, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.
Gao Jiao
First batch of individual pension fund investment products on sale, with the shortest holding period of only 360 days - www.chinanews.com
First batch of individual pension investment products on sale
Seven products of the institution can be selected, and the shortest holding period is only 360 days.
Personal pension investment products are finally launched.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the first list of personal pension investment products, and 7 personal pension investment products of China Construction Bank, Agricultural Bank of China and China Postal Savings were officially launched.

At present, the “shelves” of the individual pension account have finally been filled with four types of products, namely individual pension savings, individual pension investment, individual pension insurance and publicly offered individual pension funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of individual pension fund investment products are all publicly offered net asset value open-end products, including 5 newly issued products and 2 existing products, except for 1 product which is a mixed type product, the other 6 products are all fixed income type products.

The reporter of Beijing Youth Daily saw that among the 5 new products, 4 of them were from Bank of China Wealth Management, all of which were fixed income products with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days and 1080 days respectively, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.1

The remaining new product is “Postal Savings Wealth Enhancement Huangjinyan 1095 Day 1095 Day Short Term Holding” of fixed income type, which started to collect on February 10 and ended on February 19, with a risk level of level 2.

Among the two surviving products, one is Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management “Agricultural Bank of China Unity·Dynamic” 360-day Technology Innovation RMB Wealth Management Product, which is a mixed type investment product with a risk level of three.

Another surviving product is “Postal Savings Wealth Enhancement Hongqing 1 with the Shortest Holding Period of 365 Days,” a fixed income type, which started collecting funds on December 30 last year and officially started operating on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the Opinions of the State Council Office on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds, the financial products that the funds in the individual pension fund account can be invested in include bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, publicly offered funds, etc.
The first personal pension investment products were sold, marking the official start of personal pension investors’ ability to purchase investment products through personal pension accounts.

In November last year, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission formulated the Interim Provisions on the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Asset Management Companies.

The Measures stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension products such as personal pension savings accounts, personal pension wealth management products, personal pension insurance products, and publicly offered personal pension fund products through their personal pension accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation jointly issued a notice, clearly stating that the individual pension system would be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei Shijiazhuang, the new area of Huangan, Jincheng City, Shanxi.
As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in individual pension insurance was 19.54 million, and the number of payers was 6.13 million, with a total payment of 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, banks participating in the pilot only offered three types of products, namely personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and publicly offered pension funds.
Now that the personal pension investment products have gathered together, how should investors choose?

According to experts from the research and development department of ICBC Wealth Management, compared with other personal pension products, the pilot stage of the pension wealth management products and personal pension wealth management products have three characteristics.
First, it is prudent; the risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept are more prudent, and the third-party independent custody is implemented by non-parent banks.

Secondly, it is long-term. The duration of the pilot period for long-term care wealth management products is 5 years or more, and the holding period of the individual long-term care wealth management products to be issued next is not less than 1 year, and the holding period of 3 years or more is encouraged.

Third, it is inclusive. The products have a low purchase threshold, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The custody fee, management fee, and other fees of the products are more favorable.
Professionals pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the products and their own risk tolerance.

The characteristics of personal pension savings are long-term, high interest rates, and high safety; it is suitable for people with low risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on protection, and are suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; personal pension investment products and publicly offered fund products are not guaranteed to return the principal or earnings, have certain investment risks, but have higher expected returns and are suitable for people

Fitness industry should get rid of trust crisis - chinanews.com
Another large gym “default”?
Recently, the rights protection of members of a well-known fitness organization, Zhongxin Fitness, has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not open as usual, and then the rumor of the bankruptcy and running away of the institution caused panic among the members, leading to the involvement of the public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization made a statement and promised to try their best to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the incident was finally resolved.

Some stores of individual fitness institutions have encountered operating problems and have been temporarily closed. Consumers could have waited for the problems to be solved calmly. Why is the first reaction of many members “something is wrong”?
The backdrop of the fitness club members’ rights protection storm is the deep-seated problem of industry trust crisis.
Traditional gyms in China generally adopt a prepaid model, and “making money from users who don’t come” is the underlying logic of their development.

By obtaining cash flow through pre-sale of membership cards and opening new stores, it seems that the cycle can be repeated, but in fact, it is eating the rice of the ox and cannot form a stable profit model.
Negative news such as gyms going bankrupt is frequently reported, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
In terms of market prospects, gyms are certainly a good business with a “money-making” path.
The fitness track, although winding, has always been the focus of capital.
According to various data, the popularity of cultural consumption and other areas is constantly rising, and the market is recovering.

Specifically in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents’ living standards, the concept of healthy living has entered people’s hearts, and the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the development of quality.

However, some organizations are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, and they have just come out of the crisis and sound the horn of expansion, throwing all the financing funds into the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that many institutions have withdrawn in recent years due to the impact of the pandemic, and the industry has undergone a reshuffle. At this time, powerful enterprises choose to increase their acquisition strength and reposition themselves, which is not a new opportunity.
However, in order to develop into a healthy cycle and move towards a steady and prosperous future, the fitness industry must change its traditional mode of operation and change its business strategy.
Only by steadily building up consumer confidence and safety, can we truly win the market and win the future.
Compared with the market capture of Big Chill New Store, what the fitness industry needs most at present is to calm down and optimize services, and to stabilize users with high-quality development.
First of all, we need to rely on services to retain users.
Gyms belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to “user orientation”, to focus on user needs and to improve the quality of services.
Secondly, digital transformation is needed to improve user experience.
For example, the popular Internet gym model, which realizes user pay-per-use and site selection.
At the same time, the body data and movement data can be effectively utilized, and social needs can be met, realizing a complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private coaching and expensive annual cards, users’ concerns about gyms “running away” have been reduced, and their trust in gyms has been improved.
In addition, we need to actively explore multiple business models.

Nowadays, sports consumption has evolved from single services to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are expected to become a new entry point for consumption. Surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment required for exercise will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.
Jiang Tianji

“Price Discount Rebate” Reappears in Nanjing Real Estate Market - www.chinanews.com

Yangzhou Evening News reported (reporter Ma Zhuopu) that during an interview on the 10th, Yangzhou Evening News/Niujin News reporters found that the “price maintenance agreement” that had not been seen for more than ten years had returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in Jiangbei New Area claimed “price compensation”, and the discount of other real estate resources was greater than the previous
The conditions of the “price guarantee agreement” are not few.

The apartment complex in Jiangning District is called Poly Yichang Yuzhongtian, and Sun, who was visiting the complex, told the reporter that he found a “statement” when he visited the complex last weekend.

The photos sent to reporters by the developer of the project showed that if the buyer bought the property between February 1 and February 28, the developer would exchange the property for the buyer and return the price difference if the discount of other properties in the project was greater than the discount enjoyed by the buyer before (limited to other unsold properties of the same type of house, the same building, the same unit, and the same type of property).

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a “price maintenance agreement”, which was intended to reassure buyers that they did not have to worry about the developer reducing the price to promote sales, “now we are afraid that the price will be reduced after we buy it, and we will have no time to go to the sales office to complain, and if we don’t complain, we will really be worried”.
Many buyers also believe that the "price maintenance agreement" is a kind of "placebo" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who intends to buy a house in Jingbei, said that the house to be purchased must be the same type, in the same building and the same unit, and there are few houses to be compared, so the “threshold” is still high.
Some buyers also believe that due to the information asymmetry, the sales may offer additional discounts, and it is not easy for buyers to “fight for their rights”.
Whether the buyers of the houses can be retained is to be observed.

The journalist searched for the property on the Nanjing online real estate website and found that the two towers of the property, with a total of 252 units, were sold in November last year. The unit areas are 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the selling price of the fully furnished units is RMB 39,843/m2.

However, more than two months have passed, and the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is currently 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 128 units are in Block 8, and 113 units are unsold; 44 units in Block 7 are also unsold; the total number of transactions in the project is only 33 units, accounting for only 13
Market insiders introduced that "price maintenance agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, Lugu West Yuan in the Huaxiang Road of Hexi District launched a “price guarantee plan” to attract buyers. The specific content was “the company solemnly promises that if the project’s discount range is expanded within one year, the company will return the difference to the old owners according to the difference”.
After that, in April 2011, nine property projects in Nanjing also promised to make up the difference in price.
“The property market is recovering, and we need a ‘strong heart medicine’ at this time.
"A senior property developer in Nanjing, Mr. Shen, said that the "price maintenance agreement" is also one of the marketing methods of real estate developers.
He believes that developers need more confidence than home buyers now, and the launch of the “price guarantee agreement” is actually to boost their confidence.
As for whether the buyers will stay, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as control policies and loan thresholds, and it is still to be observed at present.
Taiwan’s economic performance in the first quarter of the year is not good - Xinhuanet

Xinhua News Agency Taipei on February 11 (reporters Zhao Bo and Huang Yang) - The export and import trade volume has been "five consecutive black", the manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) has been contracted for 7 consecutive months, the consumer price index (CPI) has seen "three-digit head",... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released the economic data of January 2023
Experts analyzed that Taiwan’s economy had a poor start in the year, and the growth pressure was not small.

According to the Ministry of Finance of Taiwan, the exports of Taiwan region were US$31.51 billion in January this year, with a year-on-year decrease of 21.2%, and negative growth for the fifth consecutive month.
The export volume of 11 major export commodities all showed a decline compared with the same period last year.
The decline in synthetic rubber and its products and optical instruments was the deepest, with year-on-year decreases of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
The export of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year on year, the largest decrease in 11 years.
Among them, the annual decrease of integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.
Cai Meina, director of statistics of the department, said that this showed the weak demand effect of the consumer electronics industry and the adjustment period of the electronics industry.
According to statistics, Taiwan's imports and exports both fell in January, and the excess amount was only US$2.34 billion, the lowest level in nearly three years.

The Department of Financial Affairs of Taiwan authorities believes that the global terminal demand is reduced, the industry adjustment of inventory inhibits the willingness of manufacturers to purchase raw materials, and the export slump is short-term and difficult to improve, and the export decline of Taiwan in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwanese Economic Research Institute, the Taiwanese manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment in January this year, a decrease of 3.3% compared with December last year, and a contraction for seven consecutive months.

In the economic monitoring indicator system, the PMI is 50% as the demarcation line of prosperity and decline, and the index is greater than 50%, which represents the expansion of the economy, and vice versa.
In January, Taiwan PMI was composed of five indicators, including new orders, production, employment, supplier delivery time and inventory turnover.

All six industries reported a contraction in PMI, and the industries were ranked in order of contraction speed as power and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optical industry (35.2%), chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation industry (42.6%) and food and textile industry (45.7%).
In terms of prices, the Mainland Affairs Council of Taiwan announced that the annual growth rate of CPI in Taiwan in January this year was 3.04%, which has exceeded 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, creating a new high in 17 months.

Cai Zhihong, a special commissioner of the Taiwan “Directorate-General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics”, said that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed beyond expectations, excluding the factors of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February of this year should be close to 2.71% of December last year, and the inflation pressure still exists and is still at a high point.
Looking forward to the Taiwanese economy this year, experts are pessimistic, according to reports from domestic media including United Daily News and Yahoo Finance.

Wu Daijiang, a professor from the Department of Economics of “Central University” in Taiwan, analyzed that the export decline may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturers and increase the risk of debt default.

At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of labor costs by manufacturers, which affects the labor market and the family economy, and in turn, it affects the consumption ability.

Qiu Dasheng, a research fellow at the Taiwanese Economic Research Institute, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, demand continues to shrink, and it is estimated that the decline in Taiwanese exports will continue in the first half of the year.
Taiwan's economy is supported by exports, and the economic growth performance of the whole year will not be as good as that of last year due to the impact of the low exports.

Henan Province regulates the integration of dental implant medical services prices - ECNS
According to the report from CCTV, dental implants are the ideal choice for many toothless patients, but the price of tens of thousands of yuan per tooth has always made many patients hesitate.
Since this year, with the accelerated landing of implantation of teeth, the price reduction of implantation of teeth has also been put on the agenda in various places.

Since February 10, the price control target of a single conventional implant dental service in Henan Province is 4,300 yuan, and the cost of a single conventional implant service is no more than 97% of the control target.
Tooth implantation refers to a method of tooth repair in which the upper part of the tooth is supported and fixed by the lower structure inserted into the bone tissue.
A reporter learned from Zhengzhou University First Affiliated Hospital that, for example, a single conventional cultivated cornea costs about 16,700 yuan from cultivation to final repair.
Patient He Wei: After the new policy, the doctor told me that for someone like me, the cost would be around 8,000 yuan or less than 10,000 yuan, and basically it could be reduced by half.

On the basis of the existing projects, Henan Province has integrated and determined 15 items of medical service prices of oral implantation, such as “implantation fee (per unit)”, and formulated the prices of public medical institutions under the administration of the province and the payment categories of medical insurance, and canceled or adjusted 20 items of medical service prices, such as dental implantation.

Li Yunjie, Director of Pharmaceutical Price and Tendering Purchasing Department of Zhengzhou Bureau of Medical Insurance: The main beneficiaries are four-sided ones, one is medical insurance, the expenditure of medical insurance is reduced; the pressure of hospitals is reduced, and patients will increase appropriately; for suppliers, they get a market; for us patients, it is the biggest benefit, the cost
Shenzhen: Building the first and leading city in China and the world in terms of speed - www.chinanews.com

Report from “Shenzhen Industry and Information Technology” WeChat public account on February 11, Shenzhen Bureau of Industry and Information Technology issued the “Shenzhen City Super Leader City Construction Action Plan” recently.

It proposes that by the end of 2023, a super broadband network with high speed, large capacity, and low latency will be built, and the goal of building a “double-gigabit, all-optical, 1-millisecond, and all-connected” network will be achieved, and a cutting-edge city will be built, which will be the first in China and the world.
The plan proposes to speed up the upgrade of the 1 Gbps optical network.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires a comprehensive improvement in the energy efficiency of 5G networks.
Research and develop quality standards for 5G network services in Shenzhen, carry out testing and evaluation of 5G networks, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support telecom enterprises to increase the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and places, and add 10,000 5G base stations in the whole year, so that the average download speed in the city reaches 500Mbps and the upload speed reaches 100Mbps, and the download speed in key areas reaches 1000Mbps and the upload speed reaches 200Mbps, and
Build high-quality wireless local area networks at the city level.

The regulations for wireless local area network (WLAN) services in public places were established, and the WLAN was upgraded in areas with high concentration of people and information consumption needs, providing 1,000 Mbps access capabilities.

Based on the construction of “Shen i Network”, a unified certification and management platform for public wireless local area networks in the city is established, realizing “one-time certification, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching”, and supporting operators to include self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities in the certification and management platform.
Upgrade the access AP quantity to no less than 20,000 by the end of 2023.

In addition, the plan also proposes to build a high-quality all-optical network, construct a multi-level computing power supply system, accelerate the construction of key communication network facilities, and improve the Internet application service capabilities.
The Plan is clear about collaborative construction of the Internet of Things system.

Explore the construction and management mode of urban sensing terminal based on the “Open Huaweion” operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, accelerate the construction of urban-level sensing platform, promote the interconnection and data exchange of urban IoT platform, various industry-specific IoT platforms and data.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things and smart perception in urban management, public welfare services, public security, transportation and other fields, and expand the fixed perception and intelligent networked vehicles and other mobile perception channels of urban roads, buildings, public facilities, etc.

By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity, gas, and Internet of Things sensing terminals will exceed 9 million, and more than 20 multi-functional smart pole application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentioned that satellite and ground communication integration applications should be strengthened, low-altitude network infrastructure should be deployed, and the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea should be promoted.
At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea, build an industrial innovation development ecology, and support the hosting of top-level competitions and events.

The Chinese e-commerce industry is emerging with “new variables”, and how can delivery do “content is king”?
- Xinhuanet
Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 11 (Reporter Liu Yijun) - With the emergence of "new variables" in China's e-commerce industry, how can the delivery of goods be "content-oriented"?
CN Econ Reporter Xia Bin
“We entered the e-commerce market late, but from the beginning, we realized that content is important if you want to stand out from the millions of stores.
Fangfang, a "90s" girl from Guangdong, is now running a store of nutritious food on the TikTok e-commerce, making a "blossom" of a brick-and-mortar store with more than 30 years of history online.
By imitating the film style of old Hong Kong movies and adding classic Cantonese songs, @FongFong’s one-person food shaking account was opened, and the exquisite videos were a breath of fresh air.

Recently, in the “Find Peers·Quality Content Sharing” special session of Douyin e-commerce, Fangfang attended as a representative of quality creators to share her experience and feelings about daily creation.

She said at the scene, “The carefully edited video has gained the attention of many netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my family, and want to cook with me, and sales have opened up at once.

With the help of the soup video, Fangfang made more people fall in love with the taste of “Laoguang,” and a live broadcast sold up to 300,000 pieces of nourishing ingredients, saving the family store that was on the verge of bankruptcy.
“No content, no e-commerce”, as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people’s requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early days of live streaming sales, live broadcasting rooms often used low price discounts to attract users, and price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there have been phenomenal big Vs such as Liu Hao and Dongfang Zhenzhu, as well as many little-known celebrities and merchants who have emerged in vertical niches. They have improved their long-term operating efficiency by continuously creating high-quality content that is consistent with their brand image.

Hao Yajian, the operation responsible person of the KOL of the TikTok e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have realized the value of their content through the TikTok e-commerce, and their content creation volume increased by 252%, and the total transaction amount has more than doubled.
"Behind these figures, we can feel a thriving author ecology with abundant vitality.
"said Gao Yahan.

The Experimental Platform for Communication Innovation and Future Media of Beijing Normal University previously released the ECHI Report on the Content Ecology Health Index of E-commerce Industry, which analyzed the importance of high-quality content in the current e-commerce industry from the perspective of data dimensions, and evaluated the content ecology situation of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China using the index.
According to the ranking of the health index of the content ecology in the e-commerce industry based on the above report, the top five are TikTok e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo and JD.com.

The report believes that the content ecology in the e-commerce industry is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce, and good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integration with e-commerce, and the content platform value is higher, and the consumption and promotion scenes are richer, and the possibility of e-commerce

At the scene, Professor Yi Guoming, a professor at the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and the chairman of the Expert Committee of Media Economics and Management of China, made an analysis and interpretation of the Report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has now transitioned from "consumer accessibility" to "consumer quality", and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as knowledge payment, professional knowledge, and KOL (Key Opinion Leaders) has begun to become a standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Qi Guomei put forward two suggestions.

One is to promote the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology from the perspective of improving the content structure, establishing positive content creation and management standards, and realizing the dynamic balance of the system index of the healthy e-commerce content ecology.
Another is to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value synergy and co-creation of the external environment from the perspective of external ecology.

In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more support in data and artificial intelligence to make predictions for future development; in addition, it should provide more standardized and healthy growth space for merchants, realize the value of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and jointly create a healthy content ecology.

Chinese rescue team continued rescue operation in Turkey and rescued 4 people trapped in the earthquake - www.chinanews.com
Report from website of Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11: On February 10, three action teams and 45 rescuers of Chinese rescue team in Turkey were sent to rescue one trapped person.
Two search and assessment groups were sent to assess and investigate the 15 buildings on Vodabashi Street.
As of now, a total of 4 people were rescued, 5 people were found dead, and 25 buildings with serious collapse were searched for signs of life and risk assessment.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force scientifically according to the actual situation of the disaster area and the rescue scene, and continue to carry out the rescue work in depth.

The rescue team obtained the information of the rescue request through various channels such as the embassy, the local government and the United Nations rescue organization, and verified it one by one through online inquiries and on-site searches.
Introduce the current rescue environment and the collapse of buildings to the Hong Kong Rescue Team, and jointly carry out search operations.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection, strengthen safety control at the rescue site, strengthen discipline requirements for rescue work, and clearly stipulate safety precautions.
The system of rotating standby duty and guard duty is continuously implemented, and the security management of the camp is strengthened.

The medical staff of the rescue team provide physical examination services for the team members every day, strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and at present, all members of the rescue team are in good health, and carry out disinfection in the camp.

After setting up the self-supporting camp, the logistics support team members set up 26 tents of four categories, including command and communication, equipment storage, medical and sanitation, living quarters, and dog houses, to ensure the safety of more than 30 sets of rescue equipment at the scene.

The Biden administration will blacklist six Chinese entities suspected of participating in the spy balloon project on Friday (February 10).

The U.S. Department of Commerce said that the five Chinese companies and one research institution helped modernize the Chinese military, especially in aerospace projects, including flying boats and planes.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.
The list is called the "entity list," and companies on the list cannot buy technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain special export licenses from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The blacklisted companies are: Beijing Nange Aerospace Science and Technology Co., Ltd., 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Longjiang Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd. of Zhongshan, Eagle Wing Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiaohang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Eagle Wing Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
The White House had previously said it was considering broader measures to "expose and address" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident caused further tension between China and the United States, and U.S. Secretary of State Blinken canceled his visit to China.

The United States shot down the balloon on February 4, and the Chinese government made a solemn representation to the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously disrupting and damaging the efforts and process of stabilizing China-US relations.

Based on the evidence of the existing debris and the information of the procurement platform of the Chinese military, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, a spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, said at a press conference on Friday that China had explained the situation and clarified its position on the accidental entry of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle into the airspace of the United States due to force majeure.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely political manipulation and sensationalism.
China is strongly dissatisfied with and resolutely opposes this.

"Today's action demonstrates the shared commitment to identify and disrupt China's use of spy balloons that have violated the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries," said Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary for export enforcement at the U.S. Department of Commerce.
A staff member of Guangzhou Tianhe Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he was not aware of the sanctions and refused to comment further, according to a report by Reuters.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States and have not yet commented on this information.
(Reuters, etc.)
