Several days have passed since the earthquake in Turkey and parts of Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is gradually fading. However, the rescue of a family of five on Saturday made the rescuers feel extremely happy.

According to Associated Press, a family of five was trapped under the rubble for more than five days in the town of Nurday, which was severely hit by the earthquake in Gaziantep Province. They were successfully rescued.
Rescuers pulled the mother and daughter from the rubble first, and then found the father, but he insisted on being rescued first, followed by his son and another daughter.
When they were all saved, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaraş, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also successfully rescued in the harsh cold weather.
“What day is it today?
"A boy trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asked the rescuers who brought him to the ground.
A man from Kahramanmaraş is holding the cat he just saved.
The miraculous success of the rescue brought a glimmer of hope to the search and rescue work that had been hopeless, but at the same time, the number of casualties continued to rise.
According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts say people can survive up to a week after being trapped in rubble, hopes of finding more survivors are fading.
Rescue workers are still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue work began to shift to helping the survivors who were in urgent need of rescue.
UN official: Disaster in the region is "unprecedented in a century"

Martin Griffiths, the United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator, said at a press conference held in Turkey that the earthquake was the “worst disaster in the region in a century”.
He also praised Turkey's response to the disaster as "extraordinary."
He also told a Reuters reporter that he hoped to provide rescue to the areas controlled by the Syrian government and the opposition, but also said that the relevant matters were "not clear".
The United Nations pledged to provide an additional $25 million in relief contributions to the people in the earthquake-stricken areas of Syria.
The United Nations announced earlier this week that it would allocate $25 million for relief efforts in Turkey and Syria.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Great Chilean earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake in human history occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a seismic moment of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
A huge tsunami triggered by the earthquake hit the coast of Chile, causing a huge tsunami with a height of 25 meters.
The tsunami also affected distant Japan and the Philippines.
The number of deaths and economic losses caused by disasters of such a wide range cannot be accurately known.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Great Alaska Earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, which was also the day of the crucifixion of Jesus.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
As of 2006, the Alaska earthquake is still the third largest earthquake in the world.
When the earthquake occurred, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate ruptured near Prince William Sound, near College Fjord.
In most areas, the earthquake lasted from three to five minutes.
The seafloor displacement caused a huge tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
The school and many businesses were closed because it was a holiday.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while another 130 died from the tsunami caused by the earthquake.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred in Tangshan City and Fengnan County, Hebei Province, China within 16 hours.
The epicenter is 23 kilometers below the ground.
Tangshan City was interrupted in transportation, communication, water supply and electricity, and was leveled in an instant.
The capital city of Beijing, which is 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, the earthquake caused 242,769 deaths and 164,851 serious injuries in all the affected areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second most deadly earthquake in China's history, second only to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
However, some overseas scientists estimated that the earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred 160 kilometers west of the west coast of Aceh Province, Indonesia, with a focal depth of 30 kilometers and a moment magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a massive tsunami with heights of 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, and the most seriously affected areas included Aceh Province, Thailand's Hua Hin and Phuket resort areas, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

The disaster occurred during the Christmas holiday season, when the affected areas were crowded with tourists and locals, leading to many tourists enjoying their holidays on the beach and locals working on the beach being swept away by the tsunami, making many of the victims of the earthquake missing persons.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people died and went missing.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Wenchuan Earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data from China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave intensity of the earthquake reached 8.2 and the rectangular intensity reached 8.3, and the affected area was more than 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing persons, 374,643 injured persons, 1,993,030 homeless persons, and a total of 46,256,000 people affected by the earthquake.
It was the most destructive earthquake since the founding of the People's Republic of China and the most deadly earthquake after the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as the National Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Day, with the aim of strengthening education for the public and paying more attention to disaster prevention and mitigation work.
Afterwards, the governments and primary and secondary schools in many parts of China held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Middle and primary schools also began to pay attention to popularizing “earthquake prevention and mitigation” education.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, Haiti, a Caribbean island country, was hit by an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0 on the Richter scale.
The epicenter is located 25 kilometers southwest of the capital city of Haiti, Port-au-Prince, and the earthquake source is about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimated that about 3 million people were affected by the earthquake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 200,000 deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of homes were destroyed in the earthquake.
Despite the massive aid and support provided by the international community, this overpopulated and corrupt impoverished country has never recovered from the disaster.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years
2011 Tōhoku earthquake
On March 11, 2011, a large tsunami earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred off the coast of the Tohoku region in Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean to the east of Sendai, the capital city of Miyagi Prefecture, and the seismic source was measured to be 24 kilometers deep. A huge tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters was triggered.
This earthquake was the first earthquake with a magnitude of over 9 in Japan since the beginning of observation.
About 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima I Nuclear Power Plant suffered a leakage accident due to the earthquake and tsunami.
The incident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear and Radiological Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident led to the measurement of trace amounts of radioactive substances around the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were thus released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of Syria and Turkey are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, as many as 5.3 million people have lost their homes due to the earthquake.
The World Food Programme (WFP) appealed for $77 million to provide food for the victims of the earthquake who were homeless in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area is as low as minus zero, and many victims have no place to live.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies have been difficult to deliver to many people in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in a civil war for 12 years, the earthquake has made the plight of the people even worse.
In the four days after the earthquake, the World Food Programme has provided food relief to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma treatment and emergency surgery.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

NEWS GOV-MO: Police News Alert: Police Department Urges Citizens to Beware of Fraudulent SMS from Fake Telecommunications Companies

Recently, the Police has received a number of cases of telecommunication fraud, where the fraudsters pretend to be the local telecommunication company and send the victim a fraudulent text message with a website link, luring the victim to log in to a fake website to redeem the reward.

The victim followed the instructions to enter the credit card information and verification code, and then received a notification from the financial institution that there were unknown purchases on the credit card, and suspected that the credit card information was stolen by the website.
After investigation, it was confirmed that the related telecommunications company did not send the above short message.

The police urged the public to be vigilant if they received similar text messages and not to click on the links in the text messages or provide any personal information; if they were asked to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be extra cautious to prevent their credit cards from being stolen and used for fraudulent transactions.
Scam alert:
1. Pay more attention to network security information and improve personal prevention awareness;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website, so as to avoid being used by others;
3. Beware of fake websites and phishing websites, and always pay attention to whether the website URL is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install antivirus software on your mobile phone, mobile device or computer and update it regularly;
If you suspect that you have been a victim of fraud or other crimes, you should call the Police Fraud Investigation Bureau at 8800 7777 or the Police Crime Hotline at 993 for assistance.

Google AI chat robot “answered wrong questions”; its parent company’s stock price evaporated by $10 billion.

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard suffered a setback when it "gave the wrong answer" in a promotional video, causing Alphabet, Google's parent company, to plunge 8.9% on Thursday, falling below the $100 mark and wiping out $110 billion (about RM476.5 billion) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet is not as competitive as its rival Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google released an advertising video of AI chat robot Bard on social media earlier. In the video, someone asked Bard: “Can you tell me about the new discoveries of James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) for my 9-year-old child?
Bard mentioned in his reply that the telescope had taken the first photo of an exoplanet in the solar system.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration of the United States, the first photo of the exoplanet was taken by the Very Large Telescope of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the story with the headline "Alphabet shares plunge after Bard's incorrect answer."

On the other hand, Google pointed out that the response of Bard "emphasizes the importance of rigorous testing process", and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that the response of Bard "meets high standards based on quality, safety and authentic information."
Singapore tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021

The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate relevant industry standards for sustainable development of conference and exhibition and incentive travel industry within 2023, and focus on improving the problems of waste treatment and carbon emissions, and further optimize the travel environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, the passenger flow of Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with more than 150,000 passengers received daily, about 1 million passengers received weekly, which is about 75% of that before the COVID-19 pandemic, and the number of airline employees has also been restored to about 90% of that before the pandemic.

According to the data, from January to October 2022, Singapore received 23.6 million visitors, accounting for 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and 170,000 flights took off and landed, accounting for 53% of the pre-pandemic period.

According to Koo, the Tourism Board will closely monitor the further signals released by China on its outbound travel policies to cope with the changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies such as Ctrip, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to receive Chinese tourists in response to new trends in outbound travel from China.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected, as long as there is no significant recession affecting public income and no new outbreak of a large-scale deadly pandemic.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted intimately, while his wife was ignored on the side.

(Combined report on September 11) North Korea held a military parade on the 8th evening to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army. Not only did Kim Jong-un’s daughter Kim Ju-ae attend the parade, but she also stood on the podium with her father.

The official media of North Korea released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Jong-un sitting beside his father, exchanging warm glances and whispers several times, and she gently hugged her father’s face with her hands, even touching her father’s chest, and the interaction between father and daughter was broadcasted to the whole country.
However, the first lady, Liu Yongfu, had to stand aside.

According to the reports of “Chosun News” and other Korean media, in the official photo of the couple with their daughter Kim Ju-ae attending the banquet, not only was Kim Ju-ae sitting in the middle of her parents in the C position, but she also stood on the podium with Kim Jong-un at the military parade on the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army the next evening.
The official media of North Korea, Korean Central Television, released the parade video afterward, revealing more scenes of deep father-daughter love.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times from the rostrum, and the two of them never stopped smiling. They even whispered to each other in their ears. Kim Jong-un’s daughter, Kim Yo-jong, even put her hands on her father’s cheeks and smiled at him. Kim Jong-un also smiled back.

Other CCTV footage also shows that the mistress, Ri Sol Ju, sat on an indoor sofa with Kim Jong-un, constantly touching his face with her hand; and when she walked with her father, she was touching Kim Jong-un's chest with her hand.
First Lady Liu Shiwu could only walk behind or sit on the side, and was always a few steps away from her husband and daughter.

According to the Korean media, since the first public appearance of the master of the ceremony on November 18, 2018, when the Mars-17 missile was launched, the probability of exposure has been increasing for three months, and it has appeared in official occasions for the fifth time.

The official media of North Korea referred to Kim Jong-un as the beloved leader, the most respected leader, and the most precious leader, and also broadcasted the footage of Kim Jong-un repeatedly shouting his determination to support the bloodline of the Kim family while looking down at the parade from the viewing stand.

These signs make people suspect whether Kim Jong-un has been designated as the successor of the Kim regime, and the Washington Post analyzes that “this is a signal that Kim Jong-un has pushed his daughter to the position of the successor when she was in high school”; however, there are also views that such a judgment is too early, and there are still various possibilities in the situation that Kim Jong-un has a son in his family.
Mid-Autumn Festival Q&A—How to view the unexpectedly high US non-farm employment data in January and the future trend - Economic Observation - Professional financial news website
Q: How does Reignwood Investment view the January U.S. non-farm employment data, which was much better than expected, and the future trend?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data of January 2023, with 517,000 new non-farm employment, which was significantly higher than the market expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; the average hourly earnings increased by 4.4% year-

In terms of quantity, there are many one-time and technical factors that disturb the data, such as the return of strikers, the revision of survey and statistical indicators, and the update of seasonal factors. Later, it may be revised (refer to the new non-farm payrolls of 364,000 in January 2022, down from 504,000); non-farm employment is not as

From the perspective of structure, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still there, but the proportion is relatively low; the employment of high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education and healthcare has increased significantly, and the data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combining the recovery of the same unexpectedly large service sector PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data, and the strength of consumer credit data, we judge that the US service industry has experienced rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that without a recession, the tightness in the U.S. labor market will be difficult to improve.

At present, the U.S. labor market still has a supply gap of more than 5 million, and the labor participation rate is slow to rise, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 year olds has approached the high point before the epidemic.
In addition, strong consumer demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the job market, as U.S. residents oversave and consume credit.
The supply and demand of the US employment market will continue to be tight, which will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.
With the end of the current tightening cycle and the persistent back-and-forth in inflation expectations, we are not optimistic about the continued decline in wage growth.
Before the release of this data, the US stock and bond markets were too optimistic about the Fed's path of interest rate hikes.

With the continuous improvement of inflation data, the Fed has been balancing the fragile balance of inflation expectations in the market while shortening the pace of interest rate hikes, but the market has ignored the hawkish expression of the Fed, and not only expects the interest rate hike to be stopped earlier, but also expects two interest rate cuts at the end of the year.

Under the situation of tight labor market supply and demand and the unclear impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed's relatively reasonable guidance for interest rate hikes at the end of the year, and the adjustment of extreme expectations of the market and the crowded trading will cause some harm to the market.

“Fund E Account” has arrived: CSRC authorizes the development of the centralized and query of all funds held by investors - Economic Observation - A professional financial news website
Journalist Chen Xia of Economic Observer reported that the complicated channels of fund purchases make it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the “little wallet”?
These problems of the Kemin will be solved soon.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the “Fund E Account” APP was uploaded and launched on the App Store and Google Play.

According to the introduction, “Fund E Account” provides a “one-stop” query service for public fund accounts and share information for individual investors, aiming to solve the pain points of forgetting accounts, querying and being troublesome for the vast number of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, by the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund managers in the country, managing fund assets of about 2.6 trillion yuan; 167 public fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The account systems of different registration agencies are independent of each other, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
According to industry insiders, at the end of 2021, China’s fund investors exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the country’s population invested in fund products.

Previously, investors needed to inquire about their purchase through different sales institutions, but through the “fund E account”, they can inquire about the purchase through all sales channels, and the holding of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the “Fund E Account” app?

According to the introduction of the relevant documents, the “Fund E Account” APP is a mobile application developed and constructed by China Securities Depository Clearing Corporation Limited, which is approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission. It can provide investors with one-stop query of the off-site holding of all public fund products in the market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the holdings of their off-exchange shares of publicly offered funds under various fund managers purchased through various sales channels in the whole market through the “Fund E Account”, which can greatly improve the efficiency of inquiries.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through “Fund E Account” includes: fund account information opened at all public fund managers, trading account information opened at public fund sales institutions, and the situation of holding off-site shares of products such as publicly offered securities investment funds and asset management plans established and managed by securities companies, where the number of investors is not limited to 200.

Liu Yicheng, the business responsible person of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the reporter of Economic Observer that investors can know the holdings of all their off-exchange public fund through the “Fund E Account” App, help them find their “forgotten assets”, and more importantly, it helps customers to collect comprehensive account information of fund investment, help customers to grasp their investment situation more timely,
How to register and use it?

The reporter found that the “Fund E Account” app has been uploaded to the app stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but the app is still in the public testing stage, and registration requires filling in an invitation code, which can be obtained by contacting the fund manager of the fund held by the investor.

A customer service person from a large public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the reporter of Economic Observer and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial stage, and China Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, which investors can get by calling, and we will provide them.
After the trial operation is over, users can register without invitation code.

The reporter registered an account and completed the query by downloading and using the relevant documents of the “Fund E account” disclosed on the official website of the CSRC. The whole process only took a few minutes and mainly included four steps: user registration, real name authentication, bonding of the fund account, and public fund query.

After clicking “Assets” to bind the fund, all the fund products purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms are displayed in the list of binding options (can be bound to accounts), and after completing the binding, you can see the total assets of the fund you invested in and start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the “Fund E account” only provides query services for investors and cannot be used for redemption and purchase.
The data displayed in the “Fund E Account” is generally the data of three trading days before the date of the user’s query (T day).
For example, when you opened the "Fund E account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value corresponding to the date were pushed back three trading days to February 7.

Asia – On February 9, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan and met with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

Both sides reached a consensus on opposing the CCP’s infringement on the South China Sea and the East China Sea. The leaders of the Philippines and Japan issued a joint statement after the meeting, saying that they would sign a trilateral defense agreement with the United States to conduct substantive defense exchanges and oppose the hegemonic policy of the CCP.

The Bar Association again mobilized a large-scale demonstration against the government’s retirement reform program.
On Saturday (February 11), French unions launched a nationwide mobilization against the government's draft pension reform, calling on people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of social protests against the government's draft reform of the pension system.
The number of people who responded to the call for the rally may affect the next action plan of the labor union group.

This is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade union groups have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization, and this is the first time that the protests have been arranged on a Saturday.

As Saturday is a day off for most French people, they do not need to choose between participating in the demonstration and going on strike, and the union groups hope that today's gathering can attract more people to participate.

The unions of the public transportation system, subway, and public railway companies did not call for a strike today, and the public transportation system should be able to operate normally, and citizens can take the public transportation to the rally site, and people can also travel normally for winter vacation in the areas where schools start winter vacation.

The union group hopes that more than 1 million people will participate in the rally today, while the police expect the number of participants nationwide to be between 600,000 and 800,000, and 90,000 to 120,000 people may gather in the city of Paris.

Since the start of the protests against the government's pension reform plan, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to delay the legal retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who have really taken to the streets to participate in the demonstrations has gradually decreased.
The first strike demonstration on January 31 gathered 1.27 million to 2.5 million people nationwide.
Meanwhile, the number of people who took part in the demonstrations on Tuesday (February 7) has shrunk to between 757,000 and 2 million people nationwide.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
The opposition parties, especially those led by the radical left, submitted numerous amendment proposals, which slowed down the process of deliberation.
The debate between the two sides is becoming more and more intense.
A member of the French Left Party recently posted a picture of himself stepping on a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labor on social media, which triggered the protest of the ruling party.

The Speaker of the National Assembly finally announced that the member of the National Assembly would be banned from participating in the activities of the National Assembly for 15 days as a punishment for this behavior.

Despite the fact that this reform plan has caused the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has made some adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions so far.

The union has already prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 16, and on March 7, when the reform draft is sent to the Senate for discussion, the union also plans to organize a demonstration.

The last communist prime minister of East Germany passed away today.
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "Last night, Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall, which separated East Berlin and West Berlin for 28 years, was opened, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At that time, the communist leaders were forced to step down due to the demands of protesters for democracy and freedom in East Germany.
After Mikhail Gorbachev came to power in the Soviet Union, he demanded changes in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free election in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results led to his resignation as Prime Minister.
Despite the reforms, opponents accused Mobutu of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He has also been criticised for attempting to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Mordell was found guilty of electoral fraud in the municipal elections of May 1989, but did not go to jail.
The allegations were said to be politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament, and from 1999 to 2004, he served as a member of the European Parliament.
Modero sees himself as a reformer who wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want a return to the old East Germany, but said the achievements of East Germany should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he served as a sergeant in the youth fire brigade and, as the conflict was coming to an end, became a member of the Nazi militia, the Volkssturm, which conscripted men aged 16 to 60 for the final struggle.
At the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he attended anti-fascist courses and became a firm member of the Communist Party.
In 1949, the year of the establishment of East Germany, he returned to his homeland and found a job as a mechanic, and continued to study social sciences and economics, and obtained a doctorate.

Modrow was a member of the Free German Youth movement, which was joined by almost all East German youth, and rose to become the chairman of the party in the Dresden region between 1973 and 1989, during the time when the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) was in power.
He also worked in the parliament of East Germany for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany and held the highest state office.
Iran marks revolution anniversary with hacking of president's TV speech

Iran held an official gathering on Saturday to commemorate the 44th anniversary of the Iranian Revolution, but the president, Ebrahim Raisi, was briefly interrupted by anti-government hackers during a televised speech.
The president's live televised speech was interrupted for about a minute on the Internet, and a group of anti-Iranian government hackers named "Edalat Ali (Ali Justice)" appeared on the screen.

According to a report by Reuters today, hackers interrupted the broadcast of the state television station on the anniversary of the Iranian Revolution.

Iran's official commemoration of the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution was met with the most audacious challenge yet from young protesters demanding the overthrow of hardline President Hassan Rouhani, but Rouhani still called on "young people who have been deceived" to repent so they can be pardoned by Iran's top leader.
Protests across Iran continue to rage after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in custody of the country's morality police in September.
Iran's security forces have used lethal force to quell protests, one of the most powerful challenges to the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution that toppled 2,500 years of monarchy.

As part of the anniversary of the revolutionary amnesty, Iranian authorities released on Friday the imprisoned political dissident Farhad Mezaami and the Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelkhah, who had been on hunger strike.
Earlier, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a pardon that included some prisoners arrested during recent anti-government protests.
According to the human rights organization HRANA, as of Friday, 528 protesters had been killed, including 71 minors.
The report says that 70 government security personnel were also killed.
It is believed that up to 19,763 protesters were arrested.
Iranian leaders and state media have been calling for a vote of support for the government and against the protests at Saturday's rally for weeks.
On Friday night, the anniversary of the Iranian Revolution, official media showed fireworks as part of the government-sponsored celebration, and people shouted "Allahu Akbar!
(God is the greatest!)".
However, many people were heard shouting "Down with the dictator!" during the rally.
" and the "Death of the Islamic Republic" in the video posted on social media.
On Saturday, state-run television broadcast live footage of official gatherings in all provinces.
In Tehran, as part of the official celebrations, domestically produced ballistic missiles, drones, anti-submarine cruisers and other military equipment were displayed.
President Leslie's speech was often interrupted by the chant "USA, go to hell" - a signature chant at state rallies.
The crowd also shouted "Death to Israel."
Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of seven French nationals detained in Iran, a factor in the deterioration of relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.
She was sentenced to five years in prison in 2020 on charges of national security.
They later placed her under house arrest, but in January she was back in jail.
Adelkhah denied the accusations.
Meshaim was released a week ago after his supporters warned that he was at risk of death due to his hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting against the compulsory wearing of headscarves.
France's foreign ministry on Friday welcomed Adelkhah's release and called for her freedom to be restored, "including by allowing her to return to France if she so wishes."
Balloon incident shines a light on America?
Strengthen restrictions on technology exports to China
According to a report by the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten its technology exports to China after the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials say the balloon incident underscores the national security threat posed by China and will help generate more political support for efforts to harden U.S. technology defenses.
The United States claimed that the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official of the US Central Intelligence Agency and currently serving at the New American Security Center in Washington.
"This is undoubtedly adding fuel to the fire and supporting the hardliners against China."

Karine Jean-Pierre, the White House press secretary, told reporters on Thursday that "we will also consider taking more comprehensive actions to expose and respond to China's larger-scale surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners.
"U.S. officials say they have briefed governments in more than 30 countries about the balloon incident, underscoring the importance of international coordination in dealing with the Chinese threat.

Emily Benso, a senior research fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, said that in addition to the actions of the Biden administration, the newly established Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party in the US House of Representatives may also put pressure on the United States to take more stringent measures to slow down China's development.
She said that lawmakers would feel increasing pressure to take a harder line, which could in turn force the White House to adopt a more aggressive policy.
The Wall Street Journal said that many people advocating for stricter export controls are also pushing to expand the scope of the controls to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government has also been working on a foreign investment review program to examine whether U.S. investments overseas pose potential national security threats from China.
Analysts say the White House may face calls to move more quickly to implement the plan.
Syrian and Turkish rescue workers worked day and night after the earthquake.

Since the strong earthquake in Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked tirelessly day and night in the ruins of thousands of collapsed buildings to rescue survivors buried under rubble.
In the cold, they often call for silence as they strain to hear any sign of life from the crumbling concrete piles.
According to a report by Reuters today, two more women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after surviving for several days.
However, the death toll caused by the earthquake has risen to 24,150.
The death toll in Turkey was 20,665, and the death toll in Syria was more than 3,500.

The 7.8-magnitude earthquake that struck on Monday and has been followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of this century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 earthquake in neighboring Iran.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 caused more than 17,000 deaths.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in 20 years, Turkish authorities said on Saturday, as rescuers pulled the women from the rubble of collapsed buildings in Turkey.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, Turkey's largest city in the southeast.
In the frigid temperatures, rescuers often called for quiet as they strained to hear any signs of life from the crumbling pile of concrete.
In Samandag district of Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a newborn, just 10 days old.
He opened his eyes wide as the baby, Yagiz Ulas, was wrapped in a blanket and taken to the field hospital.
Video footage shows that paramedics also took away his mother, who was dizzy and pale-faced on the stretcher, but conscious.
Fuat Oktay, the Vice President of Turkey, told reporters at night that 67 people were rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and 31,000 rescue personnel were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said that about 80,000 people were receiving treatment in hospitals, while 1.05 million people had been left homeless by the earthquake and were crammed into makeshift shelters.
As many people lack food in the cold winter, the public is increasingly questioning the two leaders' response to the disaster.

Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, according to Syrian official media, which reported that it was the first time he had visited the disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said it was running out of stocks in northwestern Syria, which is controlled by rebels, as the war situation complicated the relief work.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Turkey's Adana province, where he admitted that the government's response had not been as fast as it should have been.
Opponents seized on the issue to attack Erdoğan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on 14 May that could be postponed because of the disaster.
Reuters said that anger over delayed aid and the start of rescue efforts could affect the election.
Even before the quake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's 20-year rule.
Erdoğan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative moves for political gains."
The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
Critics said, "The earthquake was big, but the lack of coordination, planning and incompetence is more serious than the earthquake.

Vietnam News Agency

Vietnam News Agency Hanoi—Vietnam News Agency’s correspondent reported that the official visit to Singapore and Brunei of Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung and his wife has been successfully completed, and has achieved comprehensive, practical and specific results.
In the three days of his visit to Singapore and Brunei, Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha attended more than 30 different events.
The achievements have injected new impetus to the development of the strategic partnership and comprehensive partnership between Vietnam and Laos in a more extensive, deeper and effective direction.

During the visit to the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh continued to reiterate the foreign policy line of the Party and the State of Vietnam, namely independence, diversification, multilateralism, willingness to be a good friend and reliable partner of all countries, and a responsible member of the international community.

Strengthening relations with Singapore and Brunei is the need of each country, and they are committed to promoting the well-being of their people and to peace, stability and development in the region and the world.

At the meetings and talks, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính agreed with the leaders of Singapore and Brunei to continuously strengthen political trust with Vietnam through the exchange of high-level delegations, effective operation of bilateral cooperation mechanisms and important cooperation agreements.
Many cooperation documents were signed during the visit.

Among them, the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economic Partnership with Singapore and the Action Plan for Strengthening Comprehensive Partnership with Laos in the period of 2023-2027 are the two highlights.
Vietnam and Singapore signed the Memorandum of Understanding on Partnership for Green and Digital Economy.
Image from Vietnam News Agency

During the meeting with leaders of enterprises, the seminar or the attendance of economic forums, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh emphasized that Vietnam welcomes and creates favorable conditions for Singaporean and Bruneian enterprises to expand their investment in digital transformation, green energy, high technology, innovation and creativity in Vietnam.

This visit not only helps deepen the cooperation between Vietnam, Singapore and Brunei in various traditional fields such as politics, foreign affairs, economy, security, national defense, education and training, oil and gas, tourism and people-to-people exchanges, but also creates a cooperation framework for countries in new potential fields such as digital economy, green economy, energy transformation, innovation and creativity, smart city and sustainable development.
Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah of Brunei and Prime Minister Hun Sen are ready to enter into bilateral talks.
Image from Vietnam News Agency
During the visits to the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh arranged time to visit and listen to the thoughts and wishes of Vietnamese communities living in the localities.

During the meeting between the leaders of the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh suggested that the authorities of the two countries pay more attention to ensuring fair treatment for local Vietnamese communities, giving them opportunities to contribute to local society and nurturing the relationship between the two countries.
Both leaders agreed and supported the proposal.

Notably, Prime Minister Prayuth also shared with the leaders of the two countries the desire for a united, peaceful, stable and prosperous ASEAN community; they agreed to maintain unity and cooperation with ASEAN countries and enhance the central role of ASEAN in the complex and changing regional and international situations.

On the basis of the important achievements, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính’s official visit to Singapore and Brunei made positive contributions to the effective implementation of the foreign policy line of the 13th National Congress of the Party, which gives priority to strengthening relations with ASEAN neighboring countries, and the 12th conclusion (12-KL/TW) of the Politburo of the Party Central Committee on overseas Vietnamese

What was the "object" shot down over Alaska?
Confused and full of guesses.
The US military again used the most advanced stealth fighter jet F-22 in the afternoon of Friday (February 10) to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky of Alaska, USA.
The location of the shootdown was about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an airborne object.
A Chinese spy balloon was shot down off the coast of South Carolina in the United States after drifting in U.S. airspace for several days.

The Pentagon said the second object, which entered U.S. airspace over northern Alaska on Thursday night, was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet) and was about the size of a small car, much smaller than the previous Chinese spy balloon shot down.
The Pentagon also believes that there is no evidence that the object is maneuverable.

John Kirby, strategic communications coordinator of the National Security Council of the White House, said on Friday that although the specific appearance of the object flying in the sky was not clear, it "posed a reasonable threat to the safety of civil aircraft."
Kobe said that the object was different from the spy balloon found in the United States, and it did not have a "payload" hanging from it.
"We call it a 'body' because that's the best description we have at the moment," said Kobe.
President Biden listened to the advice of the Pentagon before ordering the shooting down of the object, and he made the decision "with extreme caution," Cooke added.

The official description of the object by the United States can be roughly summarized as: the size is about that of a small car, it has no steering wheel and no suspension device, and the altitude of flight is about 10,000 meters.
But this information does not answer the basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what mission it is carrying out.
Many online analyses and speculations suggest that it may be another Chinese balloon.
It may be from China, like the spy balloon that invaded the US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, performing some tasks in different places.
Some people also linked this "object" in Alaska with "UFO" (Unidentified Flying Object).

A report by the U.S. Newsweek quoted a tweet posted by former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer on Friday, saying, "I really hope that this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO."
"It is surprising that the satellites and balloons are being mixed up, but it is not worth triggering an interstellar conflict," said Maj.
Mayer tweeted shortly after Kobe confirmed that the object in Alaska had been shot down.
Newsweek said that it was not just Maj that suspected the object was a UFO.

Tennessee Republican Congressman Tim Burchett criticized the government's cover-up of intelligence last month, demanding that the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) release a report on "unidentified flying objects."

The author wants to express that love is not just the ups and downs on the stage, not just the urban legend of the hard and dry rocks, and not just the sticky and glue-like you and me, love is not just represented by the above, love is also the mundane life, the dull and boring day after day, and also the indifference to life
As you read this book, you may recall the quarreling couples around you, the boring marriages of people you know, and the unsatisfactory relationships.

This is the reason why I do not recommend reading it. From the aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot of the book are tasteless, unless your life is turbulent or sweet like living in a candy castle, otherwise you will feel that it is strange but not strange and boring when you read it.

And in terms of depth of thought, the daily routine is not eye-catching or expands one's thoughts and vision (this is different from Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera), and the short fragments do not explore any problems, such as what kind of mistakes lead to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I don’t recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn’t matter much.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and forms than through the story plot, which is also the reason why the reading experience of this book is not good.
It is suitable for quick reading and cannot be scrutinized.
The book is well-logical, but the content is not rich enough.
It explained what sales theory is and why, but it was weak in how to do it; it only pointed out the direction but did not give specific practices.
In addition, the book feels like it was assembled.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign ones; both well-known entrepreneurs or salesmen and those who are not well-known.
I don’t know if it’s a story compiled for the sake of example, and if some cases experienced by the author would be more convincing.
The term for customers has been changed back and forth.
The title is still customer, but in the main text, it has been changed to customer.
The e-book also had problems with misspellings, missing punctuation, and incorrect numbering.
In short, this book is a good choice as an introduction to the theory, but it is not suitable for people who are already engaged in sales and want to improve their sales level.
A Quick Guide to Internet Finance

This book is shallow and can be said to be just an introduction, which can help people quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but if you want to understand it in depth, you still need to follow the map and dig it out by yourself.

And the book was written earlier, while the later content of WeChat Pay and Alipay’s subsidy war to cultivate user habits hasn’t been mentioned yet, and the proportion of the third-party payment now is probably not as small as the book said.
Now many people take their mobile phones with them when they go out to eat, and merchants have also abandoned UnionPay because of the high bank transaction volume.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introduction book. It is obvious that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience and is very familiar with the history of financial development at home and abroad, which is why the content is so easy to understand.
It is easy to write high and mighty, but it is difficult to write simple and easy to understand.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know!
The first factor that determines a person’s job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether they are valued and appreciated in their work.

According to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs theory, after the basic survival needs of human beings are satisfied, the most urgent need is the satisfaction of psychological needs—the hope of being understood, affirmed, and recognized.
Indeed, for the Chinese people, most of them are “I love you but I can’t say it”, even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their hearts and won’t say it out loud.
In the book, the author explains five languages of appreciation: words of affirmation, acts of service, quality time, tangible gestures, and physical touch.

I think it’s not important to know what the five languages of appreciation are, but to be able to use them from the bottom of your heart to appreciate and be grateful to the people around you, whether they are family members, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the more intimate the relationship, the more praise and gratitude are needed, so that our lives can become more beautiful.
By learning how to give praise, companies can retain talent to a certain extent and reduce the rate of resignation.
Thank you to the translators for bringing us wonderful foreign thoughts and the world.

Due to the differences between Western and Eastern cultures, there are some differences between the two languages. If you have the opportunity, you can read the original version of the author, which will bring you more benefits.
Thanks again to the authors, translators, and editors for their hard work!

On the evening of September 23, my wife dropped her phone, and I immediately ordered an 8P from Amazon Malaysia. The product was in stock but not self-owned and there was no extra charge (I was secretly happy), and because it was not self-owned, the delivery was slower. The system showed that the product was expected to be delivered on September 27 at the latest.

My wife couldn’t bear it and died without a phone. Early in the morning at 6:30, she asked me to think of a solution. Later, I checked JD.com and found that there was a 256G one in stock that could be delivered on the same day. I immediately ordered another one.
The new one was bought, and I immediately thought of canceling the Amazon order.

Since the order was placed in the middle of the night, it was impossible to pick up the parcel in the morning, and at 7:30, I called customer service to cancel the order, and the customer service representative said that the order had been canceled and to wait for the notification by SMS.

Okay, I will wait patiently. When I checked my phone at noon, the order was still in the status of not shipped. I immediately contacted customer service to request to cancel the order as soon as possible. The customer service replied that it was already OK.

At 3 p.m., I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I could not help but contact the customer service again to make it clear that I had called three times, and asked them to cancel the order and inform the seller that the package must not be shipped!

The customer service contacted the seller immediately after my request, and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and that I would have to wait until the seller was familiar with the system before the cancellation of the order could be processed.
But I was clearly told by the seller that they knew about it and would definitely not ship the package, so please rest assured.
I checked the order status on Monday and found that it had been shipped, so I was speechless.
Unable to contact the seller directly, I had to call customer service again.
The handling after that was simply inexpressible, and basically, I would say one thing, and the customer service would then do something.
The order is still in the rejected state, and is being prepared to be sent again!
Won’t Amazon follow up on its own?
The company that sold it didn’t care and didn’t follow up.
From now on, I will never prepay for large items again. This is too troublesome.
